properties.areaDesc: Allegan; Kent; Ionia; Ottawa; Van Buren; Ingham; Calhoun; Barry; Eaton; Jackson; Clinton; Kalamazoo
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 11:35PM EST until February 13 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches
with the highest amounts near and south of I-94. Temperatures
will fall from near 30 just after midnight to the mid teens by
mid morning. Wind chills will fall to near zero by midday
across the area.

* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Michigan.

* WHEN...Until 7 PM EST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Hazardous travel will impact the Thursday morning and
evening commutes. Temperatures will plunge during the pre-dawn
hours this morning into the teens over most of the area by mid
morning. That will lead to icy roads for morning commute,
leading to significant travel impacts. With temperatures in the
teens road salt will not be as effective. Be advised you will
need more time for your commute Thursday morning given travel
speeds will be slowed.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will continue for the most part
overnight into the early morning hours of Thursday. The snow
over the I-94 and I-69 area may come to an end for a few hours
early this morning, but will redevelop with the passage of the
arctic front prior to dawn. The snow near and north of I-96
should persist through the early morning hours of Thursday. As
the arctic front comes through during the pre-dawn hours expect
snow to become briefly heavy with gusty winds and blowing and
drifting snow. The system snow will slowly come to an end during
the late afternoon Thursday, at which time the lake effect snow
showers are expected to develop west of US-131.
properties.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THURSDAY
